comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: This is the present day view, courtesy of Google Streetview. Here is the German Wikipedia article. The bridge dates from 1855. A fire in 1915 damaged the partly wooden bridge and the repair costs in subsequent years caused the bridge to be replaced in the 1930s.

comment.author: 77318933@N08
comment._content: yeah back then I think the bulk of eastern europe was part of the Austro-Hungarian empire.

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: Brucke is German for bridge, and Kaiserin Elizabeth would be Empress Elisabeth, this lady: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elisabeth_of_Bavaria "Her murder by an anarchist in Geneva, Switzerland in 1898 ended the life of a woman who has since become known as an enigmatic and tragic figure."

comment.author: 66151649@N02

comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content:
FJ I was the godfather and great-uncle of FJ II.

The mother of FJ II was the daughter (Elisabeth of Austria) of the brother (Karl Ludwig) of FJ I.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/tj_q8] Grand nephew, I think. His mother was Franz Ferdinand's sister.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: All of  these royal families of a certain vintage seem to have very convoluted relationships...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Not like our own King Cormac, who was just some thieving viking who rocked up one day and stole the country. If I remember rightly he married his cousin as well. There's a bit about it in his (thoroughly tedious) saga - apparently he caught sight of her ankles across a crowded room, and well, we know the rest. (the rest of his saga, btw, is primarily about fish).

comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content:
@ derangedlemur

Half-sister, they shared the same father (Karl Ludwig), but not the same mother.

@ NLI

In case of the Habsburgs they were so convoluted, that a great deal of them were mad or had the Habsburg jaw.

Who knew a picture of a bridge could be so sad?
